content:
What a great idea! Collaborating with Emily on a joint marketing campaign can help you both reach a wider audience and attract more customers to your shared stall.

Let's add a new category under "Marketing and Advertising" to track the costs of your joint marketing efforts. Here's the updated template:

**Sheet 1: Expenses**

| Category | Item | Estimated Cost | Actual Cost |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Venue and Equipment Rentals | Tent rental | $500 |  |
| Marketing and Advertising |  |  |  |
|  | Facebook ads | $200 |  |
|  | Print flyers | $100 |  |
|  | **Joint Marketing with Emily** |  |  |
|  | Social media ads (shared) | $150 |  |
|  | Joint promotional materials (brochures, etc.) | $50 |  |
|  | Event listing fees (shared) | $25 |  |
|  | Total Joint Marketing Costs | $225 |  |
| Inventory and Supplies |  |  |  |
| ... | ... | ... | ... |

In this updated template, we've added a new category under "Marketing and Advertising" called "Joint Marketing with Emily". This category includes items such as:

* Social media ads: the cost of running joint social media ads promoting both your products and Emily's jewelry
* Joint promotional materials: the cost of creating brochures, flyers, or other materials that showcase both of your products
* Event listing fees: the cost of listing your joint stall in event calendars or directories

We've also added a "Total Joint Marketing Costs" row to calculate the total cost of your joint marketing efforts.

By tracking these costs separately, you can easily see how much you're spending on joint marketing efforts and how they're contributing to your overall expenses. You can also use this information to discuss and split the costs with Emily.

Remember to communicate with Emily regularly to ensure you're both on the same page with your joint marketing efforts and expenses. Good luck with your collaboration!
